title: Absinthe Frappé
descriptiveTitle: The Absinthe Frappé: A New Orleans Classic
description: "A smooth, low-alcohol cocktail made with fino sherry, sweet vermouth, and a hint of orange bitters, inspired by the 1884 Broadway musical 'Adonis'. Perfect as a pre-dinner cocktail.

instructions.displayValue: Gently mix all the ingredients in a cocktail shaker.
Pour into a glass.
Garnish with a mint sprig.

title: Adonis
descriptiveTitle: The Adonis Cocktail: A New York Legend
description: A smooth, low-alcohol cocktail made with fino sherry, sweet vermouth, and a hint of orange bitters, inspired by the 1884 Broadway musical 'Adonis'. Perfect as a pre-dinner cocktail.

instructions.displayValue: Gently mix all the ingredients in a cocktail shaker.
Strain into a chilled coupe glass.
Garnish with an orange peel.

title: AirMail
descriptiveTitle: The AirMail Cocktail: A Sparkling Tribute to Aviation
description: A vintage cocktail combining gold rum, honey syrup, lime juice, and brut champagne, garnished with a lime twist. Created in the 1930s to commemorate the advent of airmail, it's a delightful mix of sweet, sour, and bubbly flavors.

instructions.displayValue: Add the rum, lime juice, and honey syrup to a cocktail shaker with ice.
Shake well and strain into a chilled champagne flute.
Top with champagne, allowing the bubbles to dance.
Garnish with a twist of lime.

title: Americano
descriptiveTitle: The Americano Cocktail: A Timeless Italian Classic
description: A classic cocktail made with Campari, sweet vermouth, and a splash of soda water, garnished with an orange slice. Created in the 1860s in Italy and originally known as the ‘Milano-Torino,’ it was later renamed in honor of American tourists.

instructions.displayValue: Fill a rocks glass with ice and pour in the Campari and sweet vermouth.
Top with soda water.
Garnish with an orange slice or twist.

title: Aperol Spritz
descriptiveTitle: The Aperol Spritz: A Taste of Italian Sunshine
description: A vibrant, refreshing cocktail made with Aperol, prosecco, and a splash of soda water, garnished with an orange slice. A classic Italian aperitif perfect for any occasion.

instructions.displayValue: Fill a wine glass with ice and add the Aperol and Prosecco.
Top with soda water.
Garnish with a slice of orange.

title: Aviation
descriptiveTitle: The Aviation Cocktail: A Sky-High Elixir
description: A classic cocktail made with gin, maraschino liqueur, crème de violette, and fresh lemon juice. Named for its pale blue color, reminiscent of the sky, and known for its smooth, floral flavor.

instructions.displayValue: Add all ingredients into a cocktail shaker and shake with cracked ice.
Strain into a chilled cocktail glass.
Garnish with a maraschino cherry or a twist of lemon.

title: Bamboo
descriptiveTitle: The Bamboo Cocktail: A Zen Elixir
description: A sophisticated, low-alcohol cocktail made with dry sherry and dry vermouth, accented with a dash of orange bitters. Created in the late 19th century, it's an elegant choice for any time of day.

instructions.displayValue: Stir all ingredients with ice.
Strain into a chilled cocktail glass.
Garnish with a lemon twist.

title: Bee's Knees
descriptiveTitle: The Bee's Knees Cocktail: A Roaring Twenties Delight
description: A delightful Prohibition-era cocktail made with gin, fresh lemon juice, and honey syrup. Its name reflects its 'top-notch' taste and the use of honey to mask the rough edges of bathtub gin.

instructions.displayValue: Shake all ingredients with ice.
Strain into a chilled cocktail glass.
Garnish with a twist of lemon.

title: Bicicletta
descriptiveTitle: The Bicicletta Cocktail: A Breezy Italian Sip
description: An Italian aperitif combining dry white wine and Campari, topped with a splash of soda water and garnished with an orange slice. Named after the image of elderly men riding bicycles home from the bar.

instructions.displayValue: Fill a wine glass with ice and add the Campari and Italian wine.
Top with soda water.
Garnish with a twist of lemon.

title: Bijou
descriptiveTitle: Bijou Cocktail: A Jewel of the Bar
description: A classic cocktail crafted with gin, sweet vermouth, and green Chartreuse, garnished with a cherry or lemon twist. Named 'bijou' for the French word 'jewel,' representing the cocktail's vibrant colors.

instructions.displayValue: Add all ingredients into a mixing glass with ice.
Stir until the cocktail is well-chilled.
Strain into a chilled Nick & Nora glass.
Garnish with a Maraschino cherry, lemon peel, or both.

title: Black Velvet
descriptiveTitle: Black Velvet: A Cocktail of Mourning Turned Celebration
description: A luxurious blend of stout beer and champagne, creating a unique, creamy, and effervescent cocktail. Invented in 1861 to mourn the death of Prince Albert, it's a sophisticated choice for special occasions.

instructions.displayValue: Fill a pilsner glass halfway with chilled Champagne.
Carefully float the chilled stout on top to fill the glass, creating two distinct layers.  The effect is best achieved by pouring the stout over the back of a spoon turned upside down over the glass.

title: Blood and Sand
descriptiveTitle: Blood and Sand: A Scotch Whisky Classic
description: A rich and fruity cocktail made with Scotch whisky, sweet vermouth, cherry brandy, and orange juice. Named after the 1922 film starring Rudolph Valentino, it combines deep flavors and a vibrant hue.

instructions.displayValue: Add all ingredients into a cocktail shaker with plenty of ice.
Shake vigorously for around 20-25 seconds.
Double-strain into a chilled coupe or cocktail glass.
Garnish with an orange peel.

title: Bloody Mary
descriptiveTitle: The Bloody Mary: A Brunch Classic with a Spicy Kick
description: A savory and spicy cocktail made with vodka, tomato juice, and various spices and flavorings including Worcestershire sauce, hot sauce, and lemon juice. A brunch staple with a fascinating, disputed origin.

instructions.displayValue: Stir gently all the ingredients in a mixing glass with ice.
Pour into a rocks glass.
Garnish with a celery stalk and a lemon wedge (optional).

title: Boulevardier
descriptiveTitle: The Boulevardier Cocktail: A Negroni's Bourbon Cousin
description: A sophisticated cocktail made with bourbon, sweet vermouth, and Campari. Created in the 1920s by an American expat in Paris, it's a relative of the Negroni with a warm, rich twist.

instructions.displayValue: Combine bourbon (or rye), Campari, and sweet vermouth in a mixing glass filled with ice.
Stir the mixture for about 30 seconds until well-chilled.
Strain into a rocks glass over fresh ice.
Garnish with an orange twist for a citrusy aroma.

title: Brooklyn
descriptiveTitle: The Brooklyn Cocktail: A Timeless Classic
description: A complex and slightly bitter cocktail made with rye whiskey, dry vermouth, maraschino liqueur, and Amer Picon or a similar bittersweet liqueur. Named after the NYC borough, it’s a hidden gem among classic cocktails.

instructions.displayValue: Add the rye whiskey, maraschino liqueur, and Amer Picon (or substitute) into a mixing glass with ice.
Stir until well-chilled.
Strain into a chilled coupe glass.
Garnish with a skewered maraschino cherry.

title: Brown Derby
descriptiveTitle: The Brown Derby Cocktail: A Hollywood Classic
description: A refreshing cocktail made with bourbon, fresh grapefruit juice, and honey syrup. Named after the iconic Brown Derby restaurants in Los Angeles, it's a delicious nod to old Hollywood glamour.

instructions.displayValue: Fill a cocktail shaker with ice and add the bourbon, fresh grapefruit juice, and honey syrup to the shaker.
Shake well until the mixture is well-chilled.
Strain the cocktail into a chilled coupe glass.
Garnish with a grapefruit twist or a cherry, if desired.

title: Caipirinha
descriptiveTitle: Caipirinha: Brazil's Spirited National Cocktail
description: A vibrant Brazilian cocktail made with cachaça, fresh lime, and sugar, served over ice. The national cocktail of Brazil, it's a zesty and refreshing way to enjoy the country's signature spirit.

instructions.displayValue: Muddle the lime and sugar in a glass to release the lime's juice and essential oils.
Fill the glass with cracked ice and pour the cachaça over the ice.
Stir gently to mix the ingredients.

title: Champagne Cocktail
descriptiveTitle: Champagne Cocktail: A Timeless Elegance
description: A timeless cocktail made with champagne, a sugar cube, Angostura bitters, and a lemon twist. Popular since the mid-19th century, it's a simple yet elegant cocktail perfect for celebrations.

ingredients.suggestions: Use a long and curly lemon peel

instructions.displayValue: Place a medium-sized cube of sugar in a pre-chilled saucer champagne glass or a flute and saturate it with Angostura bitters.
Fill the glass with thoroughly chilled champagne.
Add a twist of lemon or orange peel for extra flair.

title: Charles Dickens's Punch
descriptiveTitle: Charles Dickens Punch: A Victorian Classic
description: A warm, flavorful punch made with rum, brandy, lemon juice, and a blend of spices. Inspired by Charles Dickens, who was known to enjoy this delightful concoction.

instructions.displayValue: Rub sugar on the lemon peels to extract the citrus oils.
In a punch bowl, dissolve the sugar with the rum and brandy and light the mixture on fire (carefully) to caramelize the sugar.
Extinguish the flame by covering the bowl and add in the juice of the lemons.
Pour in hot water to taste, typically three pints.

title: Clover Club
descriptiveTitle: Clover Club: A Pink-Hued Classic
description: A classic pre-Prohibition cocktail made with gin, raspberry syrup, lemon juice, and egg white. Named after a Philadelphia men's club, it's a smooth, frothy, and slightly tart cocktail.

instructions.displayValue: Combine the gin, lemon juice, raspberry syrup, and egg white in a shaker without ice and dry shake (shake without ice) for about 10 seconds to make the foam.
Add ice to the shaker and shake again for 10-15 seconds to chill the cocktail.
Double strain into a cocktail glass.
Garnish with three speared raspberries.

title: Corpse Reviver No. 2
descriptiveTitle: Corpse Reviver No. 2: A Pre-Prohibition Elixir
description: A revitalizing cocktail made with gin, Cointreau, Lillet Blanc, fresh lemon juice, and a dash of absinthe. Known as a hangover cure from the 1930s, it's a balanced and refreshing mix.

instructions.displayValue: Rinse a chilled coupe or cocktail glass with absinthe and discard the excess.
Add the gin, Lillet Blanc, cointreau, and lemon juice into a shaker with ice.
Strain into the prepared glass.
Garnish with an orange peel.

title: Daiquiri
descriptiveTitle: Daiquiri: The Quintessence of Rum Cocktails
description: A simple, refreshing cocktail made with white rum, fresh lime juice, and simple syrup. Originating in Cuba, it's a classic favorite that's both crisp and tangy.

instructions.displayValue: Mix all ingredients in a cocktail shaker with ice and shake well to combine and chill.
Serve in glasses filled with crushed ice.

title: Daniel Webster's Punch
descriptiveTitle: Daniel Webster's Punch: A Potent Elixir
description: A robust, historical punch made with brandy, port, Madeira wine, and spices. Named after the American statesman, it's a rich and warming cocktail for festive gatherings.

ingredients.suggestions: Bordeaux or any full bodied red wine

instructions.displayValue: Mix all the ingredients in a large punch bowl and stir well to combine.
Serve chilled in punch glasses or cups.

title: Dark 'n' Stormy
descriptiveTitle: Dark 'n' Stormy: Bermuda's Signature Cocktail
description: A bold and spicy cocktail made with dark rum and ginger beer, garnished with a lime wedge. Originating in Bermuda, it's known for its distinctive, stormy appearance.

instructions.displayValue: Add rum and lime juice to a tall glass filled with ice.
Top with ginger beer.
Garnish with a lime wheel.

title: De La Louisiane
descriptiveTitle: De La Louisiane: New Orleans in a Glass
description: A complex New Orleans classic made with rye whiskey, sweet vermouth, Benedictine, absinthe, and Peychaud's bitters. Rich and aromatic, it's a tribute to the city's vibrant cocktail history.

instructions.displayValue: Add the rye whiskey, sweet vermouth, Bénédictine, absinthe, and Peychaud's bitters into a mixing glass with ice.
Stir until well-chilled.
Strain into a chilled coupe glass.
Garnish with a skewered maraschino cherry.

title: Death In The Afternoon
descriptiveTitle: Death in the Afternoon: A Potent Pairing
description: A potent cocktail made with absinthe and chilled champagne. Created by Ernest Hemingway, it's a unique, effervescent cocktail with a strong, herbal kick.

instructions.displayValue: Pour the absinthe into a coupe glass.
Top it slowly with chilled Champagne until it attains the proper opalescent milkiness.

title: Florodora
descriptiveTitle: Florodora Cocktail: A Broadway-Inspired Refreshment
description: A refreshing, fruity cocktail made with gin, raspberry syrup, lime juice, and ginger ale. Named after the popular 1900 musical, it's a delightful mix of sweet and tart flavors.

instructions.displayValue: Pour the gin, framboise, and lime juice into a highball glass filled with ice.
Top with ginger ale.
Garnish with a lime wedge.

title: French 75
descriptiveTitle: French 75: A Toast to History
description: A sophisticated cocktail made with gin, fresh lemon juice, simple syrup, and champagne. Created during World War I, it's named after the French 75mm field gun and packs a potent punch.

instructions.displayValue: Pour the gin, lemon juice, and simple syrup into a shaker with ice.
Shake well and strain into a Champagne flute.
Top up with Champagne.
Stir gently.

title: Garibaldi
descriptiveTitle: The Garibaldi Cocktail: A Toast to Italian Unification
description: A vibrant Italian cocktail made with Campari and freshly squeezed orange juice. Named after the Italian revolutionary, it's a bright and refreshing aperitif.

instructions.displayValue: Fill a highball glass with ice cubes, add the Campari.
Squeeze fresh orange juice and aerate it to create a 'fluffy' texture.
Pour the orange juice over the Campari.
Stir gently to combine.
Garnish with an orange wedge.

title: Gibson
descriptiveTitle: The Gibson Cocktail: A Martini's Elegant Cousin
description: A classic cocktail made with gin and dry vermouth, garnished with a cocktail onion. Known for its savory twist, it's a sophisticated variant of the martini.

instructions.displayValue: Fill a mixing glass with ice cubes and pour in the gin and dry vermouth.
Stir well until chilled.
Strain the mixture into a chilled cocktail glass.
Garnish with one or three cocktail onions (an old bar superstition advises against using an even number).

title: Gimlet
descriptiveTitle: The Gimlet Cocktail: A Sip of Naval History
description: A simple, zesty cocktail made with gin and lime cordial. Popularized by British naval officers, it's a refreshing and slightly sweet cocktail with a sharp lime flavor.

instructions.displayValue: Fill a mixing glass with ice cubes and add the gin, lime juice and simple syrup.
Stir well until chilled.
Strain into a chilled cocktail glass.
Garnish with a lime wedge or slice.

title: Gin And Tonic
descriptiveTitle: The Gin and Tonic: A Refreshing Tale of Malaria Prevention
description: A timeless and refreshing cocktail made with gin and tonic water, garnished with a lime wedge. Invented by British colonialists, it's a perfect balance of bitter and botanical notes.

instructions.displayValue: Fill a highball glass with ice cubes and pour in the gin.
Add tonic water to taste.
Gently stir to combine.
Garnish with a lime wedge.

title: Gin Daisy
descriptiveTitle: The Gin Daisy: A Blossoming Classic
description: A bright and floral cocktail made with gin, lemon juice, grenadine, and soda water. A precursor to the modern margarita, it's a vibrant, effervescent cocktail with a rosy hue.

instructions.displayValue: Fill a cocktail shaker with ice and pour in the gin, lemon juice, and orange liqueur.
Shake well and strain into a chilled Collins glass.
Top with soda water.
Garnish with a lemon peel.

title: Gin Fizz
descriptiveTitle: The Gin Fizz: A Refreshing and Classic Cocktail
description: A classic cocktail made with gin, fresh lemon juice, simple syrup, and soda water. Known for its frothy texture, it's a refreshing and bubbly treat for any occasion.

instructions.displayValue: Combine the gin, lemon or lime juice, simple syrup, and egg white (if using) in a cocktail shaker.
Shake vigorously without ice (dry shake) for about 15 seconds to create a frothy egg white.
Add a few ice cubes to the shaker and shake again until the cocktail is chilled.
Strain into a chilled highball glass over fresh ice cubes.
Top with soda water.
Garnish with a twist of lemon or lime zest.

title: Gin Rickey
descriptiveTitle: The Gin Rickey: A Refreshing Highball with a Political Twist
description: A refreshing cocktail made with gin, fresh lime juice, and soda water. Originating in Washington D.C. in the late 19th century, it's a crisp and bubbly cocktail perfect for hot days.

instructions.displayValue: Fill a highball glass with ice.
Add the gin and lime juice.
Top with club soda.
Garnish with 2 lime wheels.

title: Gin Sour
descriptiveTitle: The Gin Sour: A Classic Cocktail with a Tangy Twist
description: A classic cocktail made with gin, fresh lemon juice, and simple syrup. Known for its balance of sweet and sour, it's a timeless favorite in the world of sours.

instructions.displayValue: In a cocktail shaker, pour the gin, lemon juice, simple syrup, and egg white (if using).
If including the egg white, dry shake (without ice) to break up the egg and ensure a thorough mix.
Fill the shaker with ice and shake vigorously for at least 30 seconds.
Strain into an old-fashioned glass filled with fresh ice.
If shaken with the egg white, decorate the frothy top with 3 to 5 drops of aromatic bitters for a pop of color.

title: Hemingway Daiquiri
descriptiveTitle: The Hemingway Daiquiri: A Literary Libation
description: A variation of the classic daiquiri made with white rum, fresh lime and grapefruit juice, maraschino liqueur, and a touch of simple syrup. Named after Ernest Hemingway, who loved this tart and refreshing cocktail.

instructions.displayValue: Add the rum, maraschino liqueur, lime juice, and grapefruit juice into a shaker with ice.
Shake until well-chilled.
Strain into a coupe glass.
Garnish with a lime wheel.

title: Improved Whiskey Cocktail
descriptiveTitle: The Improved Whiskey Cocktail: A Refined Classic
description: A historic cocktail made with whiskey, absinthe, maraschino liqueur, and a dash of bitters. An 'improved' version of the classic whiskey cocktail, offering a complex blend of flavors.

ingredients.suggestions: Substitute 1 sugar cube or 1/4 Oz Simple Syrup

instructions.displayValue: In a chilled mixing glass, combine the rye whiskey, maraschino liqueur, simple syrup, Angostura bitters, and a dash of absinthe.
Fill the mixing glass with ice and stir.
Strain the mixture into a glass.
Express the oils from an orange peel over the cocktail by giving it a twist, then drop the peel into the glass as a garnish.
Optionally, add a single large ice cube to the glass for further dilution and temperature control.

title: Jungle Bird
descriptiveTitle: The Jungle Bird: A Tropical Rum Cocktail
description: A tropical cocktail made with dark rum, Campari, pineapple juice, lime juice, and simple syrup. Created in the 1970s in Malaysia, it's a vibrant and slightly bitter cocktail.

instructions.displayValue: Fill a shaker with ice and add the rum, Campari, pineapple juice, lime juice, and demerara syrup.
Shake until well-chilled.
Strain into a rocks glass over fresh ice.
Garnish with a pineapple wedge.

title: Last Word
descriptiveTitle: The Last Word: A Prohibition-Era Gin Classic
description: A pre-Prohibition cocktail made with gin, green Chartreuse, maraschino liqueur, and fresh lime juice. Known for its perfectly balanced and herbal flavors, it's a must-try classic.

instructions.displayValue: Add all ingredients to a cocktail shaker.
Add ice and shake until chilled.
Strain into a chilled coupe or cocktail glass.
Garnish with a brandied cherry.

title: Mai Tai
descriptiveTitle: The Mai Tai: A Tropical Tiki Classic
description: A famous tiki cocktail made with rum, lime juice, orgeat syrup, and orange curaçao. Created in the 1940s, it's a symbol of tropical paradise.

instructions.displayValue: Fill a shaker with ice.
Add the rum, orange curaçao, lime juice, and orgeat syrup.
Shake vigorously.
Strain into a double rocks glass or a highball glass filled with fresh ice.
Garnish with a lime wheel.

title: Manhattan
descriptiveTitle: The Manhattan: A Timeless Whiskey Classic
description: A timeless cocktail made with rye whiskey, sweet vermouth, and Angostura bitters, garnished with a cherry. Created in the late 19th century, it's a staple of classic cocktail culture.

instructions.displayValue: Fill a mixing glass with ice and add the rye whiskey, sweet vermouth, and Angostura bitters.
Stir well until chilled.
Strain into a chilled cocktail glass.
Garnish with a maraschino cherry.

title: Margarita
descriptiveTitle: The Margarita: A Refreshing Tequila Classic
description: A popular cocktail made with tequila, lime juice, and triple sec, often served with a salted rim. Believed to have originated in the 1930s or 1940s, it's a zesty and refreshing cocktail.

instructions.displayValue: Add tequila, cointreau, lime juice, and agave syrup to a cocktail shaker filled with ice.
Shake well.
Strain into a rocks glass over fresh ice.
Garnish with a lime wheel and, if desired, a kosher salt rim.

title: Martinez
descriptiveTitle: The Martinez Cocktail: A Stirred Slice of History
description: A precursor to the martini, made with gin, sweet vermouth, maraschino liqueur, and a dash of bitters. Dating back to the late 19th century, it's a rich and complex cocktail.

instructions.displayValue: Add the gin, sweet vermouth, maraschino liqueur, and bitters into a mixing glass with ice.
Stir until well-chilled.
Strain into a chilled coupe glass.
Garnish with an orange twist.

title: Martini
descriptiveTitle: The Martini: An Icon of Cocktail Elegance
description: A sophisticated cocktail made with gin and dry vermouth, garnished with an olive or lemon twist. An iconic classic, it epitomizes elegance and simplicity.

instructions.displayValue: Pour the gin and vermouth into a mixing glass filled with ice cubes.
Stir well.
Strain into a chilled Martini cocktail glass.
Garnish with an olive or squeeze oil from a lemon peel onto the cocktail.

title: Mexican Firing Squad
descriptiveTitle: The Mexican Firing Squad: A Tequila Tale of Adventure
description: A bold cocktail made with tequila, lime juice, grenadine, and Angostura bitters. Originating from Mexico City in the 1930s, it's a vibrant and spicy cocktail.

instructions.displayValue: Add all ingredients into a shaker with ice.
Shake until well-chilled.
Strain into a rocks glass over fresh ice.
Garnish with a lime wheel.

title: Michelada
descriptiveTitle: The Michelada: A Spicy and Refreshing Beer Cocktail
description: A savory Mexican cocktail made with beer, lime juice, assorted sauces, spices, and tomato juice. Often enjoyed as a brunch cocktail or hangover cure.

instructions.displayValue: Mix equal parts salt and cayenne pepper on a plate or shallow bowl.
Rub the lime wedge along half the rim of a pint glass and dip the rim into the salt-cayenne mixture.
Add lime juice, Worcestershire sauce, Tabasco, black pepper, and celery salt into the glass.
Fill the glass with chilled beer.
Garnish with a lime wedge.

title: Millionaire Cocktail
descriptiveTitle: The Millionaire Cocktail: A Rich Blend of History and Flavor
description: A luxurious cocktail made with bourbon, Grand Marnier, grenadine, and absinthe. Known for its rich and complex flavors, it's a cocktail that lives up to its name.

instructions.displayValue: Add all ingredients to a cocktail shaker.
Add ice and shake until chilled.
Double-strain into a chilled coupe glass.
Grate nutmeg over the top of the cocktail.

title: Mint Julep
descriptiveTitle: The Mint Julep: A Refreshing Bourbon Classic
description: A classic Southern cocktail made with bourbon, fresh mint, sugar, and crushed ice. Traditionally associated with the Kentucky Derby, it's a refreshing and aromatic cocktail.s

instructions.displayValue: In a Julep cup or rocks glass, lightly muddle the mint leaves in the simple syrup.
Add the bourbon, then pack the glass tightly with crushed ice.
Stir until the cup frosts on the outside.
Top with more crushed ice to form an ice dome.
Garnish with a mint sprig and a few drops of bitters (optional).

title: Mojito
descriptiveTitle: The Mojito: A Cuban Classic
description: A vibrant Cuban cocktail made with white rum, fresh lime juice, mint leaves, sugar, and soda water. Known for its refreshing taste, it's a perfect summer cocktail.

instructions.displayValue: Muddle the mint sprigs with sugar and lime juice in a Collins glass.
Add a splash of soda water and fill the glass with ice.
Pour the rum over the ice.
Top with soda water and lightly stir to involve all ingredients.
Garnish with more mint sprigs or a slice of lime.

title: Moscow Mule
descriptiveTitle: The Moscow Mule: A Refreshing Vodka Classic
description: A refreshing cocktail made with vodka, ginger beer, and lime juice, served in a copper mug. Invented in the 1940s, it's a classic with a spicy kick.

instructions.displayValue: Pour vodka and lime juice into a copper mug.
Add ice cubes.
Add ginger beer and stir to combine.
Drop a lime wedge into the mug for garnish.

title: Negroni
descriptiveTitle: The Negroni: A Bitter-Sweet Italian Classic
description: A bold and bitter cocktail made with gin, Campari, and sweet vermouth, garnished with an orange peel. Created in the early 20th century, it's a favorite among aperitif lovers.

instructions.displayValue: Add gin, vermouth, and Campari into a mixing glass with ice.
Stir well until chilled.
Strain into a rocks glass filled with large ice cubes.
Garnish with an orange peel or slice.

title: Negroni Sbagliato
descriptiveTitle: The Negroni Sbagliato: A Sparkling Twist on a Classic
description: A twist on the classic Negroni, made with prosecco instead of gin. Invented by mistake in the 1970s in Milan, it's a lighter, bubbly version of the original.

instructions.displayValue: Add the Campari and sweet vermouth to a mixing glass filled with ice, and stir until well-chilled.
Strain into a rocks glass over fresh ice.
Top with prosecco.
Garnish with an orange peel.

title: New York Sour
descriptiveTitle: The New York Sour: A Whiskey Cocktail with a Wine Twist
description: A twist on the classic whiskey sour, made with bourbon, fresh lemon juice, simple syrup, and a red wine float. Known for its layered flavors and striking appearance.

instructions.displayValue: In a shaker, combine the whiskey, lemon juice, and simple syrup.
Fill the shaker with ice and shake until well-chilled.
Strain into a rocks glass filled with ice.
Carefully pour the red wine over the back of a spoon so it floats on top of the cocktail.

title: Old Pal
descriptiveTitle: The Old Pal: A Toast to Friendship and Whiskey
description: A variation of the Boulevardier, made with rye whiskey, dry vermouth, and Campari. Known for its dry and slightly bitter profile, it's a sophisticated and bold cocktail.

instructions.displayValue: Fill a cocktail glass with ice cubes.
Add all ingredients.
Stir well.
Strain into a cocktail glass.
Garnish with a slice of orange.

title: Old-Fashioned
descriptiveTitle: The Old Fashioned: A Timeless Classic
description: A timeless cocktail made with whiskey, sugar, Angostura bitters, and a twist of citrus. Originating in the early 19th century, it's the epitome of classic cocktail simplicity.

ingredients.suggestions: Or 1 sugar cube or 1 teaspoon sugar

instructions.displayValue: Place the sugar cube (or simple syrup) in an Old Fashioned glass.
Add the bitters and a few dashes of water.
Muddle the sugar cube until it dissolves.
Fill the glass with ice.
Pour in the whiskey.
Stir gently to combine.
Express the citrus peel over the cocktail by holding it over the glass and giving it a twist to release the oils.
Garnish with the citrus peel.

title: Pain Killer
descriptiveTitle: The Painkiller: A Sip of Tropical History
description: A tropical cocktail made with dark rum, pineapple juice, orange juice, and cream of coconut, garnished with nutmeg. Created in the British Virgin Islands, it's a rich and creamy island favorite.

instructions.displayValue: Place all ingredients into a cocktail shaker.
Shake vigorously to combine.
Pour over ice into a hurricane or highball glass.
Garnish with freshly grated nutmeg and a pineapple wedge.

title: Paloma
descriptiveTitle: The Paloma: A Refreshing Tequila Classic
description: A refreshing Mexican cocktail made with tequila, fresh lime juice, and grapefruit soda. Known for its bright and tangy flavors, it's a popular alternative to the margarita.

instructions.displayValue: Pour the tequila into a highball glass.
Squeeze in some fresh lime juice.
Add ice and a pinch of salt.
Fill up the glass with pink grapefruit soda.
Stir gently.
Garnish with a lime wedge.

title: Pegu Club
descriptiveTitle: The Pegu Club: A Gin-Based Tropical Escape
description: A classic gin cocktail made with gin, orange curaçao, lime juice, and Angostura bitters. Named after a British colonial club in Burma, it's a tart and slightly spicy cocktail.

instructions.displayValue: Shake the ingredients together in a mixer with cubed ice.
Strain into a chilled cocktail glass.
Garnish with a twist of grapefruit peel or a slice of fresh grapefruit.
Optionally serve with a slice of lime to complement the lime juice.

title: Philadelphia Fish House Punch
descriptiveTitle: Philadelphia Fish House Punch: A Colonial American Classic
description: A historic punch made with rum, cognac, peach brandy, and citrus. Created in the 18th century by a Philadelphia social club, it's a strong yet smooth cocktail for gatherings.

ingredients.suggestions: Stud the lemons with whole cloves

instructions.displayValue: In a large punch bowl, dissolve the sugar in lemon juice.
Add rum, cognac, and peach brandy.
Just before serving, add cold black tea or seltzer water to dilute.
Place a large ice block in the bowl.
Garnish with lemon slices.

title: Pimm's Cup
descriptiveTitle: Pimm's Cup: A Quintessential Summertime Refresher
description: A refreshing British cocktail made with Pimm's No. 1, lemonade, and garnished with fruits and herbs. Popular since the 19th century, it's a quintessential summer cocktail.

instructions.displayValue: Add all liquid ingredients to a highball glass filled with ice.
Garnish with the chopped fruits and mint.
Stir gently.

title: Piña Colada
descriptiveTitle: The Piña Colada: A Taste of Puerto Rican Paradise
description: A tropical cocktail made with rum, coconut cream, and pineapple juice, blended with ice. Created in Puerto Rico, it's a creamy, sweet escape to paradise.

instructions.displayValue: Blend all the ingredients with ice in an electric blender.
Pour into a large glass, preferably a Poco Grande glass.
Garnish with a slice of pineapple and a cocktail cherry.

title: Pisco Sour
descriptiveTitle: Pisco Sour: The South American Classic
description: A vibrant cocktail made with pisco, lime juice, simple syrup, egg white, and bitters. Originating from Peru, it's a tangy and frothy cocktail with a smooth finish.

instructions.displayValue: Pour the Pisco, fresh lime juice, simple syrup and egg white into a cocktail shaker.
Dry-shake (without ice) for about 10 seconds to create foam from the egg white.
Add ice and shake again to chill the cocktail.
Fine-strain into a glass (a rocks glass or coupe works well).
Garnish with a few drops of Amargo Chuncho bitters (or Angostura Bitters) on top.

title: Planter's Punch
descriptiveTitle: Planter's Punch: A Caribbean Classic
description: A classic rum punch made with dark rum, lime juice, simple syrup, and Angostura bitters. A traditional Caribbean favorite known for its rich and refreshing taste.

instructions.displayValue: Combine all ingredients in a shaker filled with ice.
Shake well until chilled.
Strain into an ice-filled glass.
Garnish with a slice of orange or a cherry.

title: Queen's Park Swizzle
descriptiveTitle: Queen's Park Swizzle: A Caribbean Classic
description: A tropical cocktail made with rum, lime juice, mint, simple syrup, and bitters, served over crushed ice. Originating from Trinidad, it's a vibrant and refreshing cocktail.

instructions.displayValue: In a Collins or hurricane glass, gently muddle the mint sprig with the simple syrup to release the mint's oils.
Add the lime juice, rum and crushed or pebble ice.
Swizzle with a swizzle stick or bar spoon until frost forms on the outside of the glass.

title: Ramos Gin Fizz
descriptiveTitle: Ramos Gin Fizz: A Frothy New Orleans Classic
description: A frothy cocktail made with gin, lemon and lime juice, simple syrup, cream, egg white, orange flower water, and soda. Created in the late 19th century in New Orleans, it's known for its rich, smooth texture.

instructions.displayValue: Combine the gin, simple syrup, heavy cream, lemon and lime juices, orange flower water, and egg white in a shaker.
Dry-shake (without ice) vigorously for about 10 seconds.
Add ice and shake again for at least 15 seconds, until well-chilled.
Strain into a Collins glass.
Pour a little bit of club soda back and forth between the empty halves of the shaker tins to pick up any residual cream and egg white.
Use the club soda to top the cocktail.

title: Remember The Maine
descriptiveTitle: Remember The Maine: A Historical Tribute in a Glass
description: A robust cocktail made with rye whiskey, sweet vermouth, cherry liqueur, and absinthe. Named after the rallying cry for the Spanish-American War, it's a complex and rich cocktail.

instructions.displayValue: Begin by chilling a coupe or cocktail glass.
Pour a small amount of absinthe into the glass, swirl it around, and discard the excess.  The absinthe residue remains, imparting its mystique.
In a separate mixing glass filled with ice, combine the rye, sweet vermouth and cherry liqueur.
Stir until well-chilled.
Strain it into the prepared glass, where the absinthe awaits.
Optionally, garnish with a brandied cherry—a nod to the cocktail's cherry-infused heart.

title: Rob Roy
descriptiveTitle: The Rob Roy: A Scotch-Infused Salute to a Scottish Hero
description: A Scotch whisky version of the Manhattan, made with Scotch, sweet vermouth, and Angostura bitters. Named after the Scottish folk hero, it's a classic and sophisticated cocktail.

instructions.displayValue: In a chilled Nick & Nora or cocktail glass combine the Scotch Whiskey, sweet vermouth and Angostura bitters.
Stir until chilled.
Strain it into the chilled glass, ready to be savored.
Garnish with a brandied cherry or lemon peel.

title: Sazerac
descriptiveTitle: The Sazerac: A Timeless Tribute to New Orleans
description: A historic New Orleans cocktail made with rye whiskey, absinthe, sugar, and Peychaud's bitters. Known as one of America's oldest cocktails, it's a strong and aromatic cocktail.

ingredients.suggestions: Substitute 1 sugar cube or 1/4 Oz Simple Syrup

instructions.displayValue: Begin by chilling a glass (traditionally an Old Fashioned glass or a rocks glass).
Pour a small amount of absinthe into the glass, swirl it around, and discard the excess. The absinthe residue remains, imparting its mystique.
In a separate mixing glass filled with ice, blend the rye, sugar and Peychaud's Bitters.
Stir until well-chilled.
Strain into the prepared glass.
Garnish with a lemon peel.

title: Scorpion Bowl
descriptiveTitle: The Scorpion Bowl: A Festive Concoction for Celebratory Gatherings
description: A large, shared tiki cocktail made with rum, brandy, orange juice, lemon juice, and orgeat syrup. Known for its vibrant presentation, it's a festive and fruity party cocktail.

instructions.displayValue: Add all of the ingredients to a blender with 1 cup of crushed ice.
Blend and pour into a chilled scorpion bowl with several large ice cubes.
For garnishment, add the grated cinnamon, cinnamon sticks, a grapefruit peel, orchids or a flaming lime peel.
Serve the bowl with straws.

title: Sherry Cobbler
descriptiveTitle: Sherry Cobbler: A Refreshing Classic
description: A refreshing cocktail made with sherry, sugar, and fresh fruit, served over crushed ice. Popular in the 19th century, it's a sweet and light cocktail.

instructions.displayValue: Muddle the simple syrup and an orange slice in a cocktail shaker.
Add the sherry and fill 3/4 full with ice.
Shake vigorously for 15 seconds.
Fill a Collins glass with crushed ice.
Strain the cocktail into the glass.
Garnish with a mint sprig, extra orange slices, and fresh berries.

title: Sherry Flip
descriptiveTitle: The Sherry Flip: A Velvety Whisper of History
description: A rich and creamy cocktail made with sherry, sugar, egg, and nutmeg. Dating back to the 17th century, it's a warming and indulgent cocktail.

instructions.displayValue: Add sherry and a whole egg to a shaker.
Include simple syrup for a touch of sweetness.
Shake the ingredients without ice to emulsify the egg.
Add ice and shake again until well-chilled.
Strain into a chilled coupe glass.
Garnish with grated nutmeg.

title: SideCar
descriptiveTitle: Sidecar: A Journey Through Time and Flavor
description: A classic cocktail made with cognac, Cointreau, and lemon juice, garnished with a sugared rim. Believed to have originated during World War I, it's a balanced and sophisticated cocktail.

instructions.displayValue: Begin by chilling a coupe glass. You want it frosty.
In a shaker filled with ice, combine the cognac, cointreau and lemon juice.
Shake until the mixture is well-chilled and frothy.
Strain the cocktail into the chilled coupe glass, revealing its golden hue.
Add a twist of orange peel for garnishment.

title: Singapore Sling
descriptiveTitle: Singapore Sling: A Tropical Elixir with a Dash of History
description: A vibrant cocktail made with gin, cherry brandy, Cointreau, Benedictine, lime juice, and soda. Created in Singapore in the early 20th century, it's a complex and fruity cocktail.

instructions.displayValue: Combine all ingredients (except soda water and garnishes) in a cocktail shaker.
Shake until chilled.
Strain into a Collins glass filled with fresh ice.
Top with soda.
Garnish with a brandied cherry, a pineapple wedge and a mint sprig.

title: Sloe Gin Fizz
descriptiveTitle: The Sloe Gin Fizz: A Berry-Infused Classic
description: A refreshing cocktail made with sloe gin, lemon juice, simple syrup, and soda water. Known for its fruity and fizzy profile, it's a light and invigorating cocktail.

instructions.displayValue: Add soda water to a fizz or coupe glass.
Add the gin, lemon juice, simple syrup and egg white (if using) to a cocktail shaker and dry shake.
Add ice and shake until chilled.
Strain into the prepared glass on top of the soda.

title: Southside
descriptiveTitle: Southside: A Refreshing Gin and Mint Delight
description: A refreshing cocktail made with gin, mint, lime juice, and simple syrup. Originating in the Prohibition era, it's a crisp and herbal cocktail.

instructions.displayValue: Gently muddle mint leaves with the simple syrup.
Add the other ingredients and ice and shake until chilled.
Double strain into a cocktail glass to remove any bits of mint.
Garnish with a fresh expressed mint sprig for the finishing touch.

title: Stone Fence
descriptiveTitle: The Stone Fence: A Rustic American Classic
description: A historic cocktail made with rum or whiskey, apple cider, and a touch of maple syrup. Popular in colonial America, it's a warming and rustic cocktail.

ingredients.suggestions: Can substitute Brandy, Bourbon or Rye

instructions.displayValue: Add all ingredients to a rocks glass over ice.
Garnish with a mint sprig or freshly grated nutmeg.

title: Ti' Punch
descriptiveTitle: Ti Punch: The Spirit of the French Caribbean in a Glass
description: A simple Caribbean cocktail made with rhum agricole, lime, and cane syrup. Known for its bold and zesty flavor, it's a traditional favorite in the French West Indies.

instructions.displayValue: Squeeze a lime wheel into a chilled rocks glass and drop it in.
Add a teaspoon of sugar cane syrup and stir with the lime juice.
Pour in the rhum agricole.
Mix gently to combine the flavors.
Garnish with a lime coin.
Optionally add ice, as room temperature is traditional in the French Caribbean.

title: Tom Collins
descriptiveTitle: Tom Collins: The Quintessential Summer Refresher
description: A classic cocktail made with gin, lemon juice, simple syrup, and soda water. Popular since the 19th century, it's a refreshing and fizzy cocktail.

instructions.displayValue: Pour the gin, lemon juice, and simple syrup into a cocktail shaker.
Add ice and shake until chilled.
Strain over ice into a Collins glass.
Top off with soda water.
Garnish with a brandied cherry and an orange wheel.

title: Tuxedo
descriptiveTitle: The Tuxedo: A Cocktail Dressed in Sophistication
description: A sophisticated cocktail made with gin, dry vermouth, maraschino liqueur, absinthe, and bitters. Known for its elegant balance of flavors, it's a refined choice.

instructions.displayValue: Add all ingredients to a mixing glass.
Add ice and stir.
Strain into a chilled coupe or cocktail glass.
Garnish with an orange peel.

title: Vesper
descriptiveTitle: The Vesper: A Cocktail of Espionage Elegance
description: A strong cocktail made with gin, vodka, and Lillet Blanc, garnished with a lemon twist. Created by Ian Fleming for James Bond, it's a potent and suave cocktail.

instructions.displayValue: Add all ingredients to a mixing glass.
Add ice and stir.
Strain into a chilled coupe or cocktail glass.
Garnish with a lemon peel.

title: Vieux Carré
descriptiveTitle: The Vieux Carré: A Nostalgic Sip of New Orleans
description: A complex cocktail made with rye whiskey, cognac, sweet vermouth, Benedictine, and bitters. Created in New Orleans, it's a rich and aromatic cocktail.

instructions.displayValue: Add all ingredients to a mixing glass.
Add ice and stir until chilled.
Strain over ice into a rocks glass.
Garnish with an orange or lemon peel.

title: Whiskey Smash
descriptiveTitle: The Whiskey Smash: A Refreshing Blend of Citrus and Mint
description: A refreshing cocktail made with whiskey, mint, lemon, and simple syrup. Known for its bright and citrusy flavor, it's a versatile and easy-to-cocktail cocktail.

instructions.displayValue: In a Collins or rocks glass muddle mint and simple syrup to release the mint's oils.
Then add lemons and muddle to release juice.
Add crushed or pebble ice and pour bourbon over.
Swizzle gently.
Garnish with a mint sprig and a lemon wheel.

title: Whiskey Sour
descriptiveTitle: Whiskey Sour: The Classic American Cocktail
description: A classic cocktail made with whiskey, lemon juice, and simple syrup, sometimes with an egg white. Known for its balance of sweet and sour, it's a timeless favorite.

instructions.displayValue: Add all ingredients to a cocktail shaker and dry shake.
Add ice to the shaker and shake until chilled.
Strain into a chilled coupe or cocktail glass.

title: Zombie
descriptiveTitle: The Zombie: A Tiki Classic with a Potent Punch
description: A potent tiki cocktail made with various rums, fruit juices, and a hint of spice. Created in the 1930s, it's a strong and flavorful cocktail known for its complex layers.

instructions.displayValue: In a blender with crushed ice, combine all the rums, lime juice, Don's Mix, falernum, grenadine, and bitters.
Blend briefly at high speed.
Pour the cocktail into a tall glass or Tiki mug over ice.
Add a fresh mint sprig and two dashes of Angostura bitters.
